[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: prepare()] [Eval proof injection] Can an attacker provide manipulated EvalProofs to prepare() that cause incorrect decryption or bypass access controls? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: prepare_individual()] [Proof validation bypass] Does prepare_individual() validate that the eval_proof corresponds to the ciphertext's ID, or can attackers use proofs for different IDs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [PreparedCiphertext forgery] Can an attacker construct a PreparedCiphertext without going through proper prepare() validation, bypassing security checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: BIBECTEncrypt] [Encryption key substitution] Can attackers replace the EncryptionKey during CTEncrypt trait implementation to encrypt under malicious parameters? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Decryption oracle] Can repeated calls to decrypt() with attacker-controlled PreparedCiphertexts leak information about the decryption key through timing or error patterns? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: CTDecrypt] [Key reuse vulnerability] If the same BIBEDecryptionKey is used across multiple ciphertexts, can attackers correlate decryptions to recover key material? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Invalid ciphertext handling] Does decrypt() properly validate all fields of PreparedCiphertext, or can malformed inputs cause panics or incorrect decryption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: prepare()] [Digest manipulation] Can an attacker provide a manipulated Digest to prepare() that causes decryption with an incorrect key, leaking information? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Struct: PreparedCiphertext] [Signature preservation] Does PreparedCiphertext maintain the signature from the original Ciphertext, and can this signature be verified post-preparation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: decrypt()] [Plaintext validation] After decryption, is the plaintext type P properly validated, or can type confusion allow arbitrary data interpretation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Impl: Hash for Ciphertext] [Hash collision exploitation] Can two different Ciphertexts produce the same hash value, allowing attackers to substitute one ciphertext for another in hash-based data structures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Impl: Hash for Ciphertext] [Hash field ordering] Does the Hash implementation hash fields in the same order as signature verification checks them, preventing ordering-based attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Impl: Hash for Ciphertext] [Signature bytes conversion] Is signature.to_bytes() deterministic and collision-resistant, or can different signatures produce the same byte representation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Impl: Hash for Ciphertext] [Generic PCT hashing] Does the hashing of bibe_ct field properly delegate to PCT's Hash implementation, or can type-specific hash collisions occur? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt()] [Context binding failure] If associated_data is meant to bind the ciphertext to a specific context, can attackers reuse ciphertexts in different contexts by manipulating verify() calls? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: verify()] [Associated data injection] Can an attacker modify associated_data_bytes field directly in a deserialized Ciphertext to match their chosen associated_data for verify()? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Struct: Ciphertext] [Associated data length limit] Is there a maximum length for associated_data_bytes, or can attackers cause DoS by creating ciphertexts with gigabyte-sized associated data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: verify()] [Associated data uniqueness] Can two semantically different AssociatedData objects serialize to identical bytes, breaking the binding guarantee? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: encrypt()] [Associated data ordering] Does the to_sign tuple construction ensure associated_data_bytes is properly ordered with bibe_ct to prevent reordering attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Type alias: StandardCiphertext] [Type confusion attack] Can attackers cast between StandardCiphertext and SuccinctCiphertext to bypass type-specific security validations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: InnerCiphertext] [Trait implementation bypass] Can malicious InnerCiphertext implementations be injected that violate the expected security properties? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: CTEncrypt] [Generic plaintext exploitation] Can the impl Plaintext bound be satisfied by types that violate confidentiality assumptions, leaking sensitive data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Trait: CTDecrypt] [Decryption type substitution] Can attackers specify an incorrect Plaintext type P when calling decrypt(), causing type confusion or panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Struct: Ciphertext] [Serde bound bypass] Does the serde bound ensure PCT: DeserializeOwned is properly enforced, or can unsupported types be deserialized? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/shared/ciphertext/mod.rs] [Function: random()] [Weak test randomness] Does random() use cryptographically secure RNG, or does thread_rng() provide insufficient entropy for production use? (High)
